Articles.Content:
I'm not sure which mod I'm using that installs ORSX but is there an updated version of ORSX? I keep getting a warning that it is incompatible with 0.90.0. I checked what I believe to be the current ORSX thread but didn't see an update and just want to be sure.

Thanks
Pretty sure that was part of UmbraSpaceIndustries one of RoverDude mods you can check for a update here for what one you have http://bobpalmer.github.io/UmbraSpaceIndustries/

Pretty sure that was part of UmbraSpaceIndustries one of RoverDude mods you can check for a update here for what one you have http://bobpalmer.github.io/UmbraSpaceIndustries/

Thanks. All my other mods are up to date so I don't think its any one mod but just to ORSX dll. For reference here are the mods I have installed.

KSP: 0.90 (Win32) - Unity: 4.5.5f1 - OS: Windows 8.1 (6.3.9600) 64bit

USI Tools - 0.3

CIT - CIT_Util - 1.1.1

CIT - KERT - 1.3

Community Resource Pack - 0.3.1

Ferram Aerospace Research - 0.14.5.1

Firespitter - 7.0

Kerbal Engineer Redux 1.0 - 1.0.13.1

KSP-AVC Plugin - 1.1.5

ORSX - 0.1.3

Regolith - 0.1.1

RemoteTech - 1.5.2

SCANsat - 1.0.8.1

Karbonite - 0.5

MKS - 0.22

Did you uninstall them before updating ? for looking at a .25 install, I have and a .90 he dropped that DLL or it's not in a folder like that anymore.

EDIT- Or you might ask him on one of his pages and at looking at the ORSX file you see 

"NAME":"ORSX",
	 "URL":"https://raw.githubusercontent.com/[COLOR="#FF0000"]BobPalmer[/COLOR]/ORSX/master

Same name on his GITHUB.

EDIT- Think so DragonShadow

Edited December 24, 2014 by Mecripp2
Pretty sure ORSX is superceded by Regolith, isn't it?
USI-Tools and MKS both include ORSX in them, so when you uninstall and re-install both of those, the message should go away.
